name: Something's brewing, original painting
description: title: Something's brewing media: graphite, watercolor and gouache on paper image size: 3 x 3 in., paper size 6 x 6 in. Signed and titled. Do you ever feel like something is brewing in your life, like you are on the cusp of something? Sometimes I find myself working and waiting, as signified by the counting marks and numbers, and looking ahead into the unknown, and thinking that something is stirring. Something big and amazing and I just have to keep moving forward. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Please read the policies page for payment and shipping information and for tips on caring for the art. If you have any questions or would like to see additional images, you may reach me through the contact page. Thank you! copyright ©Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Not for resale. Back to Products

name: Violet, fine art print
description: title: Violet paper size: 6 in. x 8 in. edition size: 50 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Each spring I look forward to the first blooms that pop up around our yard. Violets often remind me of my childhood, growing up in a rural mountain area, where they bloomed profusely. I like their delicate yet detailed blooms and simple leaf shape. This is a limited edition, fine art print of my original watercolor painting. It is professionally printed on acid-free matte paper using archival inks. The paper has a smooth surface that shows the detail and color beautifully. Each print is hand-signed on the front, and titled, numbered, and signed on the back. Comes with a certificate of authenticity. Copyright watermark is for photo purposes only and not on the actual print. The lowermost photo shows the print in a standard 5 x 7 frame, with a mat window opening of 4 1/2 in. x 6 1/2 in. Frame not included with print. Shipping charges within the continental United States are included in the price of this print. Please read the policies page for payment and shipping information and for tips on caring for the art. If you have any questions or would like to see additional images, you may reach me through the contact page. Thank you! copyright ©Heather Smith Jones. name: Formation one, framed original pinhole piece
description: title Formation one media pinholes on paper framed size: 12 1/4 in. x 15 in. This piece was the first pinhole piece I made in the ongoing Formation series, a series of intricate pattern and doily inspired works. I am also interested in embossed and cut patterns in "throw away" paper products. Creating similar patterns by poking holes through paper with a needle is labor intensive and honors the notion of time and works that are made by hand. My father was a potter for many years and my mother was a weaver. Their dedication to craft has inspired me throughout my own work. This piece is professionally framed and has a reclaimed fir frame made by my husband. Please read the policies page for payment and shipping information. If you have any questions or would like to see additional images, you may reach me through the contact page. Thank you! copyright ©Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Not for resale. Back to Products

name: Zinnias no. 1, fine art print
description: title: Zinnias no. 1, from the Squares series paper size: 5 in. x 7 in., image size 2.5 in. x 2.5 in. edition size: 50 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Several years ago I began the Squares series, which are a series of small scale studies approached in a variety of ways. I return to this series from time to time, and work on them in between other paintings. Zinnias no. 1 is a new piece that I painted this summer. Inspired by the zinnias in our garden I reflected on the dots of color among the green. Working on this series is so fun, that it is hard to stop making them! I have chosen just a few favorites to offer here as fine art prints. This is a limited edition, fine art print of my original watercolor painting. It is professionally printed on acid-free matte paper using archival inks. The paper has a smooth surface that shows the detail and color beautifully. Each print is hand-signed on the front, and titled, numbered, and signed on the back. Comes with a certificate of authenticity. Copyright watermark is for photo purposes only and not on the actual print. The lowermost photo shows the print in a standard 5 x 7 frame, with a mat window opening of 4 1/2 in. x 6 1/2 in. These prints also look nice with a square cut mat. Frame not included with print. Shipping charges within the continental United States are included in the price of this print. Please read the policies page for payment and shipping information and for tips on caring for the art. If you have any questions or would like to see additional images, you may reach me through the contact page. Thank you! copyright ©Heather Smith Jones. name: Nova; we always had a place to sit in her heart, original painting
description: title: Nova; we always had a place to sit in her heart media: oil on panel size: 15 in. x 15 in. Original price: $670- This is an original oil painting on panel. The panel and frame are custom made by my husband. Wired and ready to hang. My maternal grandmother's name was Nova. Though this image is not a portrait of her, while I was painting this piece, I couldn't escape the feeling that there was something of her in it. We certainly always had a place in her heart and she in ours. Please read the policies page for payment and shipping information. If you have any questions or would like to see additional images, you may reach me through the contact page. Thank you! copyright ©Heather Smith Jones. Several years ago I began the Squares series, which are a series of small scale studies approached in a variety of ways. I return to this series from time to time, and work on them in between other paintings. Zinnias no. 4 is a new piece that I painted this summer. name: Small dandelion, fine art print
description: title: Small dandelion paper size: 6 in. x 8 in. edition size: 50 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . When I spot the first sunny dandelion blooms popping up in random places after a long winter, it encourages me that spring is on the way. Small dandelion is the second dandelion I painted this spring. The subtle color changes in the pointed leaf and tiny petals in the bloom itself were fun to paint. I enjoy enjoy from nature, and studying a subject. It's then that you can really start to see it. This is a limited edition, fine art print of my original watercolor painting. It is professionally printed on acid-free matte paper using archival inks. The paper has a smooth surface that shows the detail and color beautifully. Each print is hand-signed on the front, and titled, numbered, and signed on the back. Comes with a certificate of authenticity. description: title: Wild strawberry paper size: 6 in. x 8 in. edition size: 50 . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Wild strawberries grow along a side patch of our yard early in the year. I have always liked their long, tendril-like stems that unfold tiny yellow blooms. To me they are an elegant plant and another welcome sign of spring. This is a limited edition, fine art print of my original watercolor painting. Several years ago I began the Squares series, which are a series of small scale studies approached in a variety of ways. I return to this series from time to time, and work on them in between other paintings. Nasturtiums no. 2 is a new piece that I painted this summer. I have painted several versions of Nasturtiums, thinking about the round leaves atop stringy stems. I like the colors in this piece and the allusion of a sunny, summer day. Working on this series is so fun, that it is hard to stop making them! I have chosen just a few favorites to offer here as fine art prints. This is a limited edition, fine art print of my original watercolor painting. It is professionally printed on acid-free matte paper using archival inks. name: Branch and Bird card [37.FDC.12], [38.FDC.12]
description: This card is inspired by the birds that gather together in branches on brisk mornings. From our window, my cats and I enjoy watching the juncos, sparrows, chickadees and cardinals visiting the bird bath and feeder. I carved a linoleum block from my drawings and printed the block on my antique letterpress. The "branch and bird card" comes in silver blue ink on charcoal brown paper and white ink on red paper. Please select from the menu your color choice. Package: sold individually with coordinating envelope Dimensions: 4-Bar (3 1/2 in. x 4 7/8 in.) folded Method & Materials: linoleum block print on FSC certified, 100% recycled smooth cover weight paper; envelopes are 100% recycled. Colors: silver blue ink on charcoal brown paper with steel blue envelope or white ink on red paper with white envelope Edition: 75 of each Blue Sparrow Press™ copyright © Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Back to Products

name: Santa photo frame [24.FTC.11]
description: A holiday card with a festive graphic, fun for sharing your photos of the kids, pets, or heirloom photos. Can be used as a card or ornament and makes a great gift! Fits standard wallet-sized photos, around 2 x 3 inches. Letterpress printed using vintage type, hand-set on an antique press. name: Peace & Joy tag set [21.T.11]
description: A set of four tags to dress your holiday gifts in style. The Peace & Joy booklet tags are letterpress printed using 60pt Alternate Gothic type on heavy kraft paper. There is space for your message on the white interior pages. Tags are pre-strung using a light grey fine gauge cotton string. name: Bushel and a Peck letterpress print [41.P.13]
description: Lately while working, this song has been popping in my head. My grandmother used to sing "A bushel and a peck, and a hug around the neck" to us. So I had to print it! I like the pastel ink colors on the heavy black paper, and the blue cows. This limited edition print is made by me using antique type set by hand on a 1930's era Vandercook letterpress. The print is run through the press three times, once per color, and is made slowly with lots of care. Package: sold individually, numbered and signed on the back. Dimensions: 8 1/2 x 11 inches. Method & Materials: letterpress on 140lb. black paper, 100% recycled content. Colors: pastel pink, yellow, turquoise blue. Edition: 49 Blue Sparrow Press™ copyright © Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Not for resale. Back to Products

name: Oak leaf card [39.FDC.12]
description: I have always been intrigued by the shapes of leaves and often draw or paint them. For this card I carved a linoleum block from my drawings and printed the block on my antique letterpress. I like the quiet boldness of this image. The silver grey ink evokes a crispness, like the feel of a brisk autumn morning. Package: sold individually with kraft envelope Dimensions: 4-Bar (3 1/2 in. x 4 7/8 in.) folded Method & Materials: linoleum block print on FSC certified, 100% recycled smooth cover weight paper; envelope is 100% post-consumer fiber. Colors: silver grey ink on white paper Edition: 75 Blue Sparrow Press™ copyright © Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Back to Products

name: Lion and Lamb Peace card [36.FDC.12]
description: The concept of this card references Isaiah 11:6 which says, "The wolf will live with the lamb, the leopard will lie down with the goat, the calf and the lion and the yearling together; and a little child will lead them." For this card I hand carved a linoleum block from my drawings of a lion and a lamb surrounded by star shapes and a peace branch. Then I printed the block on my antique letterpress. At 5x7 inches, this is the largest card I have in stock and is a limited edition of 50. The image makes a gentle impression in the beautiful cotton paper. This card would also look nice in a frame, perhaps hung in a child's room! Package: sold individually with red envelope Dimensions: A7 (5 in. x 7 in.) folded Method & Materials: letterpress on 110lb. cotton paper; envelope is FSC certified and 30% post-consumer fiber. Colors: blue ink on white paper Edition: 50 Blue Sparrow Press™ copyright © Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Back to Products

name: Blue Sky Farm Cow letterpress print [40.P.13]
description: Cows! Boy, do we have some antique and vintage cow blocks. So I thought I'd start a series of cow prints. This is the first a features a handsome bull surrounded by roses, stars, roosters, tiny chicks, and other ornaments. "Blue Sky Farm" is faintly legible at the top in a warm yellow. This limited edition print is made by me using antique type set by hand on a 1930's era Vandercook letterpress. The print is run through the press four times, once per color, and is made slowly with lots of care. Package: sold individually, numbered and signed on the back. Dimensions: 8 x 10 inches. description: A cheery card featuring a propeller airplane toting a HELLO! banner through sunshiny clouds. So cheery! Each card was run through the press three times for the design. Cards are printed on the front and back and blank inside for your message. These all occasion cards are nice to have on hand to send a simple hello, thank you, or special greeting. The men have different types of facial hair, the kids become like superkids adorned with power headdresses, and the bears sport a badge and crown. name: Friend letterpress Print
description: Show your friends and loved ones you appreciate them by giving art! This print makes a sweet gift any time of year, because friends are always awesome! I made these prints on my 1930's era Vandercook press using vintage type, hand-mixed inks and lots of heart. Prints are mailed with a sturdy acid-free backing in a protective sleeve and shipped in a stay-flat or bubble mailer. Print fits in a standard 5 in. x 7 in. frame, or it looks nice in an 8 in. x 10 in. frame with a mat opening of 4 1/2 in. x 6 1/2 in. Package: sold individually and unframed. Each print is hand-signed and dated. Dimensions: paper size 5 in. x 7 in. Method & Materials: letterpress on archival 100% cotton, acid free 245 gm/m2 paper. Colors: color choices: tomato crush (red), "razzle berry", or mango yellow. Please select color from the drop down menu. Edition: 25 of each color. Blue Sparrow Press™ copyright © Heather Smith Jones. Artist maintains copyright, even upon transfer of sale. Back to Products

name: Cars and Trucks print [H.1.P.11]
description: A three-color hand-pulled letterpress print layering letterpress on top of a woodblock print. There are 34 different pieces of vintage and antique type featured from our collection. Cars include a Cadillac, Corvette, Dodge van, Oldsmobile Cutlas, Impala, Jaguar, Mustang, MG, Porsche, and several VW Bugs. This print is great for the car enthusiast, collector, and would be darling in a child's room. Package: sold individually. Each print is hand titled, numbered, and signed. name: Collector's Series No. 1 [3.CS.FDC.11]
description: Wanting to make a print that reflected the mark making aspects of my paintings and drawings, I carved two separate wood blocks to make the abstract layers in this card. The soft blue colors are inspired by bachelor's buttons from our garden, and black letterpress accents are punctuated across the print surface. Card is printed on front and back, and blank inside for your message. This card is the first in the Blue Sparrow Press Collector's Series. Works in the Collector's Series will be issued in very small editions and are considered small works of art, something a little special for you to give. Prints are numbered and hand initialed. Package: sold individually with envelope Dimensions: A2 (4 ¼ in. x 5 ½ in.) folded Method & Materials: wood block print and letterpress on 110lb. cotton paper; envelope is cotton fiber.
